name: brrelex12i
params: class c0, class c1, class c2
body: |- wi(wbr(c0, c1, c2), wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe)))

stmt.origin: mpan(wbr(c0, c1, c2), wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe)), wrel(c1))

body.origin:
|- wi(wbr(c0, c1, c2), wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe)))
-| wrel(c1)
-| wi(wa(wrel(c1), wbr(c0, c1, c2)), wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wbr(c0, c1, c2), wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe)))
-| wrel(c1)
-| wi(wa(wrel(c1), wbr(c0, c1, c2)), wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe)))

body.origin: |- wi(wa(wrel(c1), wbr(c0, c1, c2)), wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wbr(c0, c1, c2), wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe)))
-| wrel(c1)

comment: Two classes that are related by a binary relation are sets. (An artifact of our ordered pair definition.) (Contributed by BJ, 3-Oct-2022.)
